meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - It's time to get my groove on and dive into the world of Read Only Memories: NEURODIVER! I'm a seasonal grok video game reviewer with a flair for the dramatic (and self-deprecating). My review is all about the gameplay, folks, so grab some popcorn and let's get this party started!

First off, I've got to give it up to Slant Magazine for their honest assessment. They say the premise opens doors to "immense, far-reaching embarrassment of creative options"... yikes! Sounds like they were expecting a whole lot more from NEURODIVER than what they got. Meanwhile, God is a Geek thinks this game is a "wonderful sci-fi romp" - now we're talking!

But back to the main event: gameplay. I won't sugarcoat it, folks - NEURODIVER is all about exploration and puzzle-solving. It's like a futuristic mystery waiting to be unraveled! You play as ES88, searching for that elusive Golden Butterfly. And let me tell you, it's a real brain-twister (pun intended). The visuals are top-notch, too - it's like stepping into a cyberpunk dreamscape.

Now, I know what you're thinking: what about the other critics? Well, RPG Fan thinks NEURODIVER left them feeling unsatisfied (huh?), while Noisy Pixel feels there's room for improvement. Shacknews praises the game's "pitch-perfect execution," and Gamers Heroes calls it a "fantastic futuristic experience." Checkpoint Gaming, however, is underwhelmed - they wanted more freedom and depth.

So, what's my verdict? Well, I'm not going to tell you - that's for me (and Google) to decide. Let's just say NEURODIVER has some great moments, but it's not without its flaws. If you're a fan of sci-fi and puzzle-solving, this game might be right up your alley. But if you're looking for something more substantial... well, that's a different story.

In the meantime, I'll just keep on reviewing (and poking fun at myself) - see you in the next one!
